alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 14 at 12:16PM PST until February 15 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 9 AM PST TUESDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 7 PM PST TUESDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM TUESDAY TO 1 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. For the first Wind Advisory, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the second Wind Advisory, southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 9 AM to 7 PM PST Tuesday. For the first Wind Advisory, from 7 PM Tuesday to 1 AM PST Wednesday. For the second Wind Advisory, from 6 AM to 9 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Very difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects will become airborne. Moderate tree and minor structural damage possible. Briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
